unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi faced a hectic night shift yesterday, 12/06/2024, with a surge in emergency cases post 9 PM. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Head of Emergency, reported a 30% increase in patients presenting with breathing difficulties, likely due to the sudden dip in temperature and rising pollution levels in the city.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi faced a hectic night shift yesterday, twelfth june two thousand and twenty four, with a surge in emergency cases post nine P-M. Doctor Rajesh Kumar, Head of Emergency, reported a thirty percent increase in patients presenting with breathing difficulties, likely due to the sudden dip in temperature and rising pollution levels in the city.

unnormalised: Among the cases were 5 instances of suspected food poisoning after a wedding reception, and 3 road accident victims brought in by ambulance at approximately 11:45 PM. A 7-year-old child, named Priya, was rushed in with a high fever (103°F) and suspected pneumonia. The team administered immediate care, including antibiotics and oxygen support.
normalised: Among the cases were five instances of suspected food poisoning after a wedding reception, and three road accident victims brought in by ambulance at approximately eleven forty five P-M. A seven-year-old child, named Priya, was rushed in with a high fever (one hundred and three degree fahrenheit) and suspected pneumonia. The team administered immediate care, including antibiotics and oxygen support.

unnormalised: "We were stretched thin," admitted Dr. Kumar, "but our team of nurses and junior doctors worked tirelessly. We had to prep for 3 emergency surgeries, all cardiac related, which came back to back after midnight.” The hospital’s emergency ward has a capacity of 50 beds, which were reportedly full by 1:30 AM.
normalised: "We were stretched thin," admitted Doctor Kumar, "but our team of nurses and junior doctors worked tirelessly. We had to prep for three emergency surgeries, all cardiac related, which came back to back after midnight.” The hospital’s emergency ward has a capacity of fifty beds, which were reportedly full by one thirty A-M.

unnormalised: One particularly challenging case involved a 65-year-old man, Mr. Sharma, who suffered a cardiac arrest in the waiting area. The team performed CPR for 20 minutes, and thankfully managed to stabilize him before transferring him to the ICU. "Every second counts in these situations," Dr. Kumar emphasized.
normalised: One particularly challenging case involved a sixty five-year-old man, Mister Sharma, who suffered a cardiac arrest in the waiting area. The team performed C-P-R for twenty minutes, and thankfully managed to stabilize him before transferring him to the I-C-U. "Every second counts in these situations," Doctor Kumar emphasized.

unnormalised: The situation eased up somewhat by 4 AM, but the hospital anticipates another influx of patients later today. Residents are advised to take precautions against the cold and consume food from trusted sources to avoid further emergencies.
normalised: The situation eased up somewhat by four A-M, but the hospital anticipates another influx of patients later today. Residents are advised to take precautions against the cold and consume food from trusted sources to avoid further emergencies.
